meanings.definition: The act of making marks or cuts on a surface
meanings.sent1: She practiced her scoring on the paper, trying to improve her technique.
meanings.sent2: The artist's scoring on the canvas added depth and texture to the painting.
meanings.sent3: The cat's scoring on the furniture left a trail of destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent4: The scoring on the tree trunk told the story of years gone by.
meanings.sent5: The delicate scoring on the pottery showcased the artist's skill.

meanings.definition: The process of gaining points in a game or competition
meanings.sent1: His scoring in the basketball game helped his team secure a victory.
meanings.sent2: The player's high scoring throughout the season earned him the title of MVP.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's scoring of acorns in the contest surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her consistent scoring in the tournament made her a formidable opponent.
meanings.sent5: The team celebrated their scoring with cheers and high-fives.

meanings.definition: The act of obtaining something desired or advantageous
meanings.sent1: Her scoring of the job offer was a relief after months of searching.
meanings.sent2: The company's successful scoring of the new contract boosted their profits.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's scoring of the last nut in the tree made it the envy of its peers.
meanings.sent4: His clever scoring of the rare book at the auction impressed the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The student's scoring of the scholarship opened up new opportunities for her.
